intro: Comandra linearis, commonly known as the linear comandra, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Comandra linearis is often found in desert or semi-desert regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small animals.
